intro: Aphanamixis cumingiana, commonly known as the Cuming's aphanamixis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are alternate and have a rough, textured surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
